text: The 1963 Fresno State Bulldogs football team represented Fresno State CollegeCalifornia State University, Fresno was known as Fresno State College from 1949 to 1971. during the 1963 NCAA College Division football season. The team was led by fifth-year head coach Cecil Coleman, and played home games at Ratcliffe Stadium on the campus of Fresno City College in Fresno, California. They finished the season with a record of four wins and six losses (4–6, 2–2 CCAA). ==Schedule== ==Team players in the NFL/AFL== The following were selected in the 1964 NFL Draft. {|class="wikitable" width="65%" |- align="center" style="background:#A81933;color:#FFFFFF;" | Player || Position || Round || Overall || NFL Team |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Jim Long || Back || 12 || 155 || San Francisco 49ers |} The following were selected in the 1964 AFL Draft. {|class="wikitable" width="65%" |- align="center" style="background:#A81933;color:#FFFFFF;" | Player || Position || Round || Overall || AFL Team |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Jim Long || Fullback || 22 || 175 || Oakland Raiders |} ==Notes== ==References== Fresno State Category:Fresno State Bulldogs football seasons Fresno State Bulldogs f
